meanings.definition: Deliberately created rather than arising naturally or spontaneously.
meanings.sent1: The contrived story seemed too forced to be true.
meanings.sent2: The contrived smile on her face didn't reach her eyes.
meanings.sent3: His contrived excuse for being late was so obvious.
meanings.sent4: The contrived set design made the play feel artificial.
meanings.sent5: The contrived plot twist left the audience feeling unsatisfied.

meanings.sent1: The contrived decorations at the party looked out of place.
meanings.sent2: The contrived painting lacked the artist's usual passion.
meanings.sent3: The contrived attempt at humor fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The contrived atmosphere in the room made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The contrived melody in the song felt forced and unnatural.

meanings.definition: Showing effects of planning or manipulation.
meanings.sent1: Her contrived reaction to the news made him suspicious.
meanings.sent2: The contrived emotion in his voice gave away his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The contrived surprise on her face was comical.
meanings.sent4: The contrived appearance of coincidence was actually carefully orchestrated.
meanings.sent5: The contrived attempt to appear innocent only made him look guilty.
